page.title: 18SCROPTON VILLAGE
page.content: Scropton is quite a large village. It has{a pub ,a garage}and{a shop}in it. It is not on a real main road, there is just a lane going through the middle. There is no{school}any more it was closed in 1951. The Derby to Uttoxeter{railway}goes through the village with a{level {crossing}and a{signal box}but{no {station.}Scropton has a large{church, St. Paul's, and{two graveyards,}one of which has about twenty graves of people who were killed in air crashes in the Second World War. There are a lot of{houses}which are mainly{owner-occupied. Scropton also has a{riding school for {the disabled.}It is the only one in Derbyshire. On the outskirts is a very large {turkey farm.
